title: acroman08
author: acroman08
content: I am surprised no one is talking about this here yet, I guess it's probably because no one really knows who DK Yoo is(even I don't know who he is).anyway, Manny Pacquiao is having an exhibition match against DK Yoo in a boxing match on December 10. I am not that interested in who he is fighting but I'd still watch the fight because I want to see Pacquiao in the ring again. besides, Pacquiao said that he'd give us a "real fight"(he said in one of the articles I've read) which I hope he would actually do. also, I saw in one of the articles that Proceeds from the event will be donated to the homeless in the Philippines and families affected in Ukraine.img source

comments.author: TravelMug
comments.body: I think it has been discuss here a bit, https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5370631.0But yes, nevertheless it deserved a separate thread since this is the legendary Manny Pacquiao first exhibition match against a Youtuber.And of course, everyone is interested to see Manny in the ring again, after all he is one of the greatest, but he had to retired from professional boxing. Good to hear that the proceeds will go the homeless in the Philippines, that is good to hear the Manny is helping his fellow countryman in whichever he can.

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: Quote from: TravelMug on October 18, 2022, 09:03:17 PMI think it has been discuss here a bit, https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5370631.0But yes, nevertheless it deserved a separate thread since this is the legendary Manny Pacquiao first exhibition match against a Youtuber.And of course, everyone is interested to see Manny in the ring again, after all he is one of the greatest, but he had to retired from professional boxing. Good to hear that the proceeds will go the homeless in the Philippines, that is good to hear the Manny is helping his fellow countryman in whichever he can.This is what I like Pacquiao, if he will go back inside the ring even just for exhibition fight. The proceeds won't really go entirely to his pockets, but there is charitable organization or entities that will benefit. If all exhibition matches will have this mission, I believe it is worth watching them even if it is not a real fight.Pacquiao is already a politician and he has good life already, but he is willing to be back for the sake of less fortunate people. I will also watch this for the mere thought that this Legend in boxing will try to show his prowess inside the ring one more time, even just for entertainment purposes.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Maybe the fight is still in December that's why there is no thread about this exhibition fight. But I agree that we missed Manny in the ring, and so this is the next big thing for us to see, him and DK Yoo in a exhibition match. His presence in Japan with Floyd shows that this might be Manny's thing in the future. And I do agree that this gesture of giving the money that we will be making in this fight for Filipinos is what distinguished Manny from other boxers like Floyd, they are all for the money.

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: There’s no news and hype with this match, maybe because it’s just an exhibition match and we already know who will gonna win on this. Yes, after the busy life of Pacquiao in politics, it’s good to see him back in the ring. Is this already settled? Less than 2 months now and yet Manny is still in Korea doing some show. Well, let’s see if there will be odds for this exhibition match, that’s still possible though.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: So he's following the footsteps of retired boxing professionals who can't really hang up their gloves hehe. I find this unfortunate but I guess he still needed all that exposure to be relevant. The good side here is that the money generated from the event will be donated to Ukraine's relief efforts.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: There is hype is this fight, it's that there are so many professional fights that is worth talking and we all know that this is just a exhibition fight to begin with.But with Manny entering the world of entertainment and exhibition fight, for sure this is just a test on his part. Yes, he is present in Floyd's fight in Japan and Floyd even travel to the Philippines. So I expect that this is just the beginning for Manny and there will be another one in the future, maybe in Japan or Saudi Arabia wherein Manny has a lot of fans as well.

comments.author: Fatunad
comments.body: Im not even know on whose DK yoo but made out some research https://en.everybodywiki.com/Dk_yooSo this guy had some history of martial arts but currently this guy is a Youtuber.So its expected for some exhibition fight to happen once again.

comments.author: milewilda
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on October 18, 2022, 10:44:25 PMSo he's following the footsteps of retired boxing professionals who can't really hang up their gloves hehe. I find this unfortunate but I guess he still needed all that exposure to be relevant. The good side here is that the money generated from the event will be donated to Ukraine's relief efforts.Better than those boxers who do really pocketed out all of the money that they had earned on an exhibition match. This is just like on what Tyson had done on his amount earned on a charity  which is something commendable for a retired legend to do so.Same goes for Pacquiao whom do consider on doing the same.Its not bad honestly but just like the rest been saying that this is really lacking some hype yet i dont even know on whom he would be fighting.If its an another known personality then we might already noticed this earlier or directly.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Quote from: milewilda on October 18, 2022, 11:20:00 PMQuote from: Yogee on October 18, 2022, 10:44:25 PMSo he's following the footsteps of retired boxing professionals who can't really hang up their gloves hehe. I find this unfortunate but I guess he still needed all that exposure to be relevant. The good side here is that the money generated from the event will be donated to Ukraine's relief efforts.Better than those boxers who do really pocketed out all of the money that they had earned on an exhibition match. This is just like on what Tyson had done on his amount earned on a charity  which is something commendable for a retired legend to do so.Same goes for Pacquiao whom do consider on doing the same.Its not bad honestly but just like the rest been saying that this is really lacking some hype yet i dont even know on whom he would be fighting.If its an another known personality then we might already noticed this earlier or directly.Pac is a politician so it's also a public show. He is also a businessman, there were articles that he owns a lot of businesses in his country so that's a very big factor for him to just give away his money. He doesn't need the money for he can survive and countless of his descendants in the future.The fight had been mentioned in some boxing threads but this is an exhibition fight that also promotes Korean youtuber.

comments.author: rodskee
comments.body: Quote from: acroman08 on October 18, 2022, 05:43:00 PM.img sourcewhile I love seeing Manny Pacquiao once again go up the ring and fight , But this lessen my interest seeing this as Exhibition game.as we can see about what had happened to the recent exhibition games that gathers nothing but criticism and attacks.Hoping that this will not damage the good reputation of this Legendary boxer from the philippines and will end better as the  proceed will be for the benefits of war victims.will Watch the game of course as I am a fan of Manny no matter who he will be facing.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: It's probably because it's an exhibition match, and we're still like a month and a half away from the fight itself. Pacquiao as well might not be naturally pushing for publicity with it, I don't think he needs it nor is it his main profession in the first place. The Youtuber himself also seems to only be popular on certain circles after all. Quote from: acroman08 on October 18, 2022, 05:43:00 PManyway, Manny Pacquiao is having an exhibition match against DK Yoo in a boxing match on December 10. I am not that interested in who he is fighting but I'd still watch the fight because I want to see Pacquiao in the ring again. besides, Pacquiao said that he'd give us a "real fight"(he said in one of the articles I've read) which I hope he would actually do. I do hope it's going to be a real fight, not just on Pacquiao's side but also on the other side. Took a peek at his YT channel and I saw how he has a few fights and showcases his skill. Also for those curious, there were a few uploads of the official announcement and press conference of their fight on his YT channel.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: Wexnident on October 19, 2022, 01:15:15 AMIt's probably because it's an exhibition match, and we're still like a month and a half away from the fight itself. Pacquiao as well might not be naturally pushing for publicity with it, I don't think he needs it nor is it his main profession in the first place. The Youtuber himself also seems to only be popular on certain circles after all. That's right, this is only an exhibition match, and looks like they are doing it to collect founds to help people, so, that's something nice, but i don't think they will really fight serious.I'm not even sure if exhibition matches get listed in sport books since they are as the nay say, just an exhibition. But if they get listed they i'm sure Pacquiao would be the easy money bet, let's be patient for the fight because before that we will have the world cup.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Quote from: Wexnident on October 19, 2022, 01:15:15 AMIt's probably because it's an exhibition match, and we're still like a month and a half away from the fight itself. Pacquiao as well might not be naturally pushing for publicity with it, I don't think he needs it nor is it his main profession in the first place. The Youtuber himself also seems to only be popular on certain circles after all. Quote from: acroman08 on October 18, 2022, 05:43:00 PManyway, Manny Pacquiao is having an exhibition match against DK Yoo in a boxing match on December 10. I am not that interested in who he is fighting but I'd still watch the fight because I want to see Pacquiao in the ring again. besides, Pacquiao said that he'd give us a "real fight"(he said in one of the articles I've read) which I hope he would actually do. I do hope it's going to be a real fight, not just on Pacquiao's side but also on the other side. Took a peek at his YT channel and I saw how he has a few fights and showcases his skill. Also for those curious, there were a few uploads of the official announcement and press conference of their fight on his YT channel. I did tried checking DK Yoo match with Scott, he actually has the skills and he also claimed to have martial art experience. Although he put his hands down while fighting Scott, he did a lot of head movement and can indeed box.I think he is also following the path of the Logan brothers in Asia which he should be fighting the Logans instead if he wants more promotion. The only issue with this is the money since Logans its what they are after.

comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on October 18, 2022, 10:44:25 PMSo he's following the footsteps of retired boxing professionals who can't really hang up their gloves hehe. I find this unfortunate but I guess he still needed all that exposure to be relevant. The good side here is that the money generated from the event will be donated to Ukraine's relief efforts.At least in his case he has not spend too much time in retirement so even if he is not in his top shape I expect that he still has something left in the tank and give a good enough exhibition, but there are other boxers which are coming back to the ring after many years or even decades of retirement, and to me this is not only not interesting but it can be even dangerous as their bodies are nowhere near the same as they were and they do not have the same capabilities of absorbing damage as they did in their youth.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: acroman08 on October 18, 2022, 05:43:00 PMI am surprised no one is talking about this here yet, I guess it's probably because no one really knows who DK Yoo is(even I don't know who he is).anyway, Manny Pacquiao is having an exhibition match against DK Yoo in a boxing match on December 10. I am not that interested in who he is fighting but I'd still watch the fight because I want to see Pacquiao in the ring again. besides, Pacquiao said that he'd give us a "real fight"(he said in one of the articles I've read) which I hope he would actually do. also, I saw in one of the articles that Proceeds from the event will be donated to the homeless in the Philippines and families affected in Ukraine.This is the kind of fight that Manny Pacquiao should be doing now that he is retired, Mayweather has success doing exhibitions after his retirement so why not on Pacquiao who is considered to be one of the greatest fighters of all time, I doubt this fight will end in a knock out like what we've often seen Mayweather exhibition fights, not because Pacquiao lose the knockout power that he has he wants to entertain more andhe is more considerate of his opponents, but we'll see if his opponent is a weak one he might end up knocking him out.

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: This isn't talked about because this is just an exhibition match. There isn't much to gamble on exhibition matches actually. The possibility that both fighters will take it lightly is very high. Mayweather also had exhibition matches that weren't discussed much here as well. Although I also want to see Manny Pacquiao perform, I think this will not be the kind of fight that I want to see. Perhaps I just missed the fighter Manny. I'm even more excited about the exhibition match of Ricky Hatton and Marco Antonio Barrera. At least they're both professional boxers and solid fighters. DK Yoo is not even that.

comments.author: Sarah Azhari
comments.body: Quote from: acroman08 on October 18, 2022, 05:43:00 PManyway, Manny Pacquiao is having an exhibition match against DK Yoo in a boxing match on December 10. I am not that interested in who he is fighting but I'd still watch the fight because I want to see Pacquiao in the ring again. Yes me too, I am very interested to watch him again, besides that, I don't expect the result, Manny or Yoo win not have much effect on the rank and their achievement, but of course, the result will affect to Ukraine citizens, Because I heard they will donate the whole income. it's still an interesting fight, Yoo body is bigger than Manny, maybe his jeb will land smoothly on Manny chin

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: Fundamentals Of on October 19, 2022, 02:25:11 AMThis isn't talked about because this is just an exhibition match. There isn't much to gamble on exhibition matches actually. The possibility that both fighters will take it lightly is very high. Mayweather also had exhibition matches that weren't discussed much here as well. Although I also want to see Manny Pacquiao perform, I think this will not be the kind of fight that I want to see. Perhaps I just missed the fighter Manny. I'm even more excited about the exhibition match of Ricky Hatton and Marco Antonio Barrera. At least they're both professional boxers and solid fighters. DK Yoo is not even that. Yeah, actually i just found out about  Mayweather's exhibition fight in local News day after the fight though Floyd is the most controversial and popular boxer in our time yet His exhibition game does not gather much here in forum.also support that idea about this kind of fight isn't attract much in gambling world because of what turns out of the other exhibition fight conducted in Pandemic time.but given a chance to bet? yes I will put some in this fight .

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: Quote from: Reatim on October 19, 2022, 02:51:57 AMQuote from: Fundamentals Of on October 19, 2022, 02:25:11 AMThis isn't talked about because this is just an exhibition match. There isn't much to gamble on exhibition matches actually. The possibility that both fighters will take it lightly is very high. Mayweather also had exhibition matches that weren't discussed much here as well. Although I also want to see Manny Pacquiao perform, I think this will not be the kind of fight that I want to see. Perhaps I just missed the fighter Manny. I'm even more excited about the exhibition match of Ricky Hatton and Marco Antonio Barrera. At least they're both professional boxers and solid fighters. DK Yoo is not even that. Yeah, actually i just found out about  Mayweather's exhibition fight in local News day after the fight though Floyd is the most controversial and popular boxer in our time yet His exhibition game does not gather much here in forum.also support that idea about this kind of fight isn't attract much in gambling world because of what turns out of the other exhibition fight conducted in Pandemic time.but given a chance to bet? yes I will put some in this fight .You may put some but I think it should be a small amount. Just to be safe. Fighters like Pacquiao and Mayweather and others don't even train hard for these kinds of fights. These are matches for fun. They won't be reflected in their professional records. So they're not really coming out hungry and angry, full of determination to win, in their best of shapes, etc. I would understand if bookmakers won't even release odds for this fight and other exhibition matches.
